column7: Notes (NB: only major reclass, i.e., change to first 4 digits of an entire code, is captured. Changes to 5/6-digit codes, or reclass of part of a code, is not)
Supposed to be 31-33

column2: Wood Television, Radio, and Sewing Machine Cabinet Manufacturing
column7: Reclassed to 321999, "All Other Miscellaneous Wood Product Manufacturing," in 2012.

This NAICS code was in fact discontinued starting in 2007, and split across six other codes. There are still some PERM entries that use this code, but due to the complexity of this case and the small number of related entries, no action taken. (One solution: to use a different name for the 3391 category, but this seemed too complicated.)

column5: Industrial Machinery and Equipment Merchant Wholesalers
column7: Not a valid code for 2002, 2007, 2012, or 2017. Accompanying NAICS title in the actual PERM dataset is 42183, "Industrial Machinery & Equipment Wholesalers." Likely corresponds to 423830, "Industrial Machinery and Equipment Merchant Wholesalers," which is a valid code from 2002-17.
Supposed to be 44-45

column2: Prerecorded Tape, Compact Disc, and Record Stores
column7: Reclassed to 443142, "Electronics Stores," in 2012.
Found in PERM dataset. See 452111 and 452112.
Found in PERM dataset. See 452111 and 452112.
Merged into 452210, "Department Stores," in 2017.

Split across 452210, "Department Stores" (for "insignificant perishable grocery sales") and 452311, "Warehouse Clubs and Supercenters" (for "significant perishable grocery sales"), in 2017. For our own tracking purposes, reclassed wholly to 4522 to keep the pre-2017 4521 code (all department stores) together.

column5: General Merchandise Stores, including Warehouse Clubs and Supercenters
column7: Found in PERM dataset. See 45291 and 45299.

column5: General Merchandise Stores, including Warehouse Clubs and Supercenters
column7: Found in PERM dataset. See 452910.

column5: General Merchandise Stores, including Warehouse Clubs and Supercenters
column7: Reclassed to 452311, "Warehouse Clubs and Supercenters," in 2017.

column5: General Merchandise Stores, including Warehouse Clubs and Supercenters
column7: Found in PERM dataset. See 452990.

column5: General Merchandise Stores, including Warehouse Clubs and Supercenters
column7: Reclassed to 452319, "All Other General Merchandise Stores," in 2017.
Supposed to be 48-49

516 is not a valid NAICS code for 2007, 2012, or 2017. Likely corresponds to the only 2002 entry beginning with "516," which is 516, "Internet Publishing and Broadcasting." See that entry for further details.

Accompanying NAICS title in the actual PERM dataset is 5161 or 51611, "Internet Publishing and Broadcasting." Corresponds to 2002 code: 516110, "Internet Publishing and Broadcasting." Reclassed to 519130, "Internet Publishing and Broadcasting and Web Search Portals," in 2007.
Reclassed to 519130, "Internet Publishing and Broadcasting and Web Search Portals," in 2007. See the other related codes 516, 5161, and 51611.
Found in PERM dataset. See 517110.
Found in PERM dataset. See 517110.
Merged into 5173 code as 517311, "Wired Telecommunications Carriers," in 2017.
Found in PERM dataset. See 517210.
Found in PERM dataset. See 517210.
Merged into 5173 code as 517312, "Wireless Telecommunications Carriers (except Satellite)," in 2017.

Found in PERM dataset; originally 517211, "Paging" in NAICS 2002. Reclassed to 517210, "Wireless Telecommunications Carriers (except Satellite)," which itself was reclassed to 517312, "Wireless Telecommunications Carriers (except Satellite)," in 2017.

Found in PERM dataset; originally 517212, "Cellular and Other Wireless Telecommunications," in NAICS 2002. Reclassed to 517210, "Wireless Telecommunications Carriers (except Satellite)," which itself was reclassed to 517312, "Wireless Telecommunications Carriers (except Satellite)," in 2017.
See 517310. Note that only 51731, NOT 5173, should be reclassed to 5179.

Reclassed to 517911, "Telecommunications Resellers," in 2007. This complicates things a bit; in 2017, 5173 started housing wired and wireless telecommunications, so 5173 itself CANNOT be directly reclassed as 5179 or you risk merging the two unrelated categories. The PERM data appears to largely use the "Telecommunications Resellers" designation for now, however.

column2: Cable and Other Program Distribution; Unclassified
column7: Accompanying NAICS title in the actual PERM dataset is 51751, "Cable and Other Program Distribution." Corresponds to 2002 code: 517510, "Cable and Other Program Distribution." Reclassed to 517110, "Wired Telecommunications Carriers," in 2007, then subsequently to 517311 in 2017.
Reclassed to 517110, "Wired Telecommunications Carriers," in 2007, then subsequently to 517311 in 2017. See 51751.

column2: Internet Service Providers and Web Search Portals
column7: Fairly complicated case. Constitutes several subsidiary codes: see (1) 51811, (2) 518111, and (3) 518112. Not possible to disaggregate. Only covers 2 entries though. Reclassed per 51811.

column2: Internet Service Providers and Web Search Portals
column7: (1) Listed in PERM database as 5181 or 51811, "Internet Service Providers and Web Search Portals." Mix of (2) and (3); not possible to discern which. Covers under 100 entries. Visual inspection suggests many entries were filed under Google, and are hence categorized as 518112 (reclassed to 519130).

column2: Internet Service Providers; Data Processing, Hosting And Related Services
column7: (2) Listed in PERM database as 518111, "Internet Service Providers," corresponding to a code last used in 2002. However, this 2002 code was split across two separate codes in 2007. Broadband ISP companies (e.g., cable, DSL) were reclassed as 517110, "Wired Telecommunications Carriers," and ISPs providing services via client-supplied telecommunications connection were reclassed as 517919, "All Other Telecommunications." May be worth ignoring, only about 20 - 30 entries. (Amendment: reclassed uniformly as 517110, itself reclassed to 517311, for simplicity.)

column2: Web Search Portals; Data Processing, Hosting And Related Services
column7: (3) Listed in PERM database as 518112, "Web Search Portals," corresponding to a code last used in 2002. This was reclassed as 519130, "Internet Publishing and Broadcasting and Web Search Portals." Significant number of applications (1000s) classed as this, many linked with Google.
Reclassed to four distinct codes under 5311 in 2007. Recommend just following suit.

column2: Real Estate Investment Trusts; Other Investment Pools and Funds
column7: Found in PERM dataset. See 525930.
